Review: Â The customer service from the Radisson staff was exceptional, they could not do enough for us. I booked to stay with my young daughter and we had some specific needs for our stay, but nothing was a problem. The communication in the lead up to our stay was excellent, so I knew everything was sorted and I did not need to worry. Our room was beautiful (received a free upgrade), very spacious and immaculate. The hotel is in a central location too, which was important for us. In those very strange times, when Glasgow was in lockdown, we had a very pleasant stay. Highly recommend, would definitely stay again.
Title: Excellent service, lovely hotel

Review:
Â Spacious room, hotel centrally located and near all shops. Had an issue with first room  allocated to us, went back down to reception and spoke to Lee about our issues, took him all of 5 minutes to sort us a new room - Radisson are lucky to have him, genuine and very good at his job - would give him 10 out of 10 and employee of the month if I could. Really knows how to treat his guests.
Have stayed in a few Radisson Hotels and have never been disappointed. Would definitely recommend to my family and friends.
Title: Friendly reception staff who could not do enough for you. Lee deserves a special mention.

Â Located right next to central station in the centre of town the location is great. Modern and clean with good sized beds, selection of pillows large en suite with shower over bath. 
Staff were also excellent and Covid procedures gave comfort. 
Would have given full marks but for two things
1.  The air conditioning was loud and I had to switch it off. 
2. The TV is completely locked down so I couldnâ€™t screen mirror my films from my iPad

Review: Â Staff where lovely, room was spotless
Title: Exceptional

Review: Â The breakfast was included with overall price and was amazing. Staff serving at breakfast were friendly and helpful, very quick to see to your requests. Only suggestion I would have is to maybe add toast to the menu handed out so people are aware you can order toast? Apart from this though, faultless! The room was quiet, as soon as you stepped in to the room you blocked out the outside world it was quiet and relaxing. The bed is super comfy! The lightning in the bathroom is amazing too. Currently with the pandemic there is no stocked minibar and whilst some would see this as a con, I quite liked this as me and my partner chose to use this as a fridge for our drinks and water, I liked having that choice of stocked minibar or not. The staff are some of the most friendliest you will meet they show interest in your stay and travels and are very professionally dressed, they see to your requests with such friendliness. Upon check out we left our bags for a few hours in the luggage room which I think is a great addition! It truly shows the Radisson is a more upmarket hotel yet not at an upmarket cost when paired with other nearby hotels so why wouldnâ€™t you choose a little bit of luxury with Radisson? We had a particular great experience with a reception staff member whoâ€™s name we didnâ€™t quite catch on his badge! Ryan? We are unsure but a special thanks to him, very kind and friendly, remembers you and takes great interest in your stay.

Review: Â Having recently stayed at this hotel, I would like to convey my gratitude for the highest level of customer service that was offered to myself and my husband, upon receiving some news regarding the Ill health of a close relative, which caused us to have to cancel a planned second night. Ryan, at reception, went above and beyond to ensure that we were able to check out quickly without fuss and with no financial penalty. During our short stay all of the staff, from the friendly breakfast host to the very well informed and progressional bar manager, were exceptional within their roles. Thank you.

Review:
Â The hotel was in a perfect location. The room was amazing. Very spacious for 2 people, tv had lots of channels to choose from, wifi was brilliant and toiletries in the bathroom were very handy.
The bar had a very nice relaxed atmosphere and staff very nice, helpful and friendly.
Restaurant food was very nice but small portions. And breakfast was very nice, lots to choose from.
Hand sanitizers in the lobby and in the elevator.
Beautiful hotel, we will definitely be back.

Review:
Â Booked this hotel for my mother & mother-in-law while they were attending a concert at the SECC Hydro in Glasgow.
Their report was that Radisson Blu, Glasgow was Ideally located, modern, clean, attractive hotel in the heart of Glasgow with highly professional staff, offering a service second to none. 
They ate in the restaurant prior to attending their concert & had breakfast in the morning, both were full of nothing but praise for both the staff & the quality of food. 
I canâ€™t thank everyone at Radisson Blu, Glasgow enough. 
Iâ€™m sure they will both insist on staying with you any time they are venturing to Glasgow to attend future events.
Title: Perfect Stay

Review: Â Proximity to City Centre and Railway. Excellent service from moment of Arrival until Departure from all staff. Dinner in Restaurant was good value for money. Breakfast was outstanding with good quality products catering for Full Scottish and Continental tastes. The Fire Alarm was activated accidentally during my stay but from a safety point if view it was well handled and managed by Staff which was reassuring should the activation having been more serious. Highly recommend this Hotel.

Review: Â The night staff were fabulously welcoming and helpful. I arrived late as Iâ€™d been at a Cher concert (awesome btw), and was tired and hungry. The receptionist suggested some fast food places still open in the area or that I could order pizza to have in my room. 15 mins later, a charming night porter brought my pizza and appletizer. Heavenly! Afterwards, I collapsed into a comfy kingsize bed with heavy comforting duvet. I slept soundly.
Title: I believe in life after love.

Review: Â We had a brilliant weekend in Glasgow.  The hotel is comfortable and the staff were really helpful.  Breakfast was abundant, very good and worth the cost.  Upon check-in, we were given a voucher for a free drink at the bar, which was a nice touch.  Free newspaper in the morning was also welcomed.  The location is really convenient for the train station.   I would definitely stay again.  We were having such a lovely time we were sad we had to leave.  Glasgow is also a really vibrant city with plenty to do.  There is also a little pub around the corner that does Karaoke, which was a hoot.
Title: Lovely hotel for a nice weekend break that is a bit special

Review: Â Glasgow can be a challenging city with obvious drug, alcohol and prostitution issues in the immediate hotel area. The minute you step inside the Radisson, you feel completely secure again. The hotel is ultra modern but in a tasteful way. Cleanliness is obviously very high on hotel management's agenda. Quietness prevails.
Title: Security, style and comfort in the heart of Glasgow.

Title: Excellent hotel, friendly staff & very comfortable

Review:
Â The shopping, lovely jewellery arcade, especially the oldie worldie jewellers (which I always frequent, los of antique jewellery that's different...oops and spent a few grand ......well not my money), Ohhh and the pubs, I like Waxy O'connors, we always go in there.....it's like the house that jack built...In fact everywhere around George Square area is nice......arrr yes The Anchor, lovely place to eat and drink, a bit more upmarket (you don't have to dress up or anything) and The Counting House where we had a drink with Bonnie Prince Charlie.......Crikey the buildings are gorgeous, the architecture could rival London any day (not the crap high rises of London) but the buildings that were made to last.....and do last.....I love going there at least once a year.....(off to Edinburgh soon...spooky vaults and Mary King's close....must see....)
By the way kids have to be over 18 to get into the places I mentioned, especially after a certain time and they are very strict on that which is good).  If it's a pub that sells food then I think it's ok.  But I was always in my bed by 8.....knackered, all that shopping, it's exercise in itself......arrr yes you can even take their funny teeny weeny tube from the bottom of Buchanan to the top (which I did on a rainy day (as my partner had a hangover)...costs Â£1.70??? or thereabouts....anyway you can't get lost as the tube only goes round and round and round.
The 2 young girls are our friends daughters and they wouldn't let them in at first, til their dad had a word, they are 21 and 18....for heavens sake...I've also added The Anchor Line eatery and drinkng place and a lovely building...The Counting House, yours truly in waxy's being daft and the other half.......after the hangover....giggles.....
Title: A really nice stay (except for the dossers) hahahaha.

Title: Great Hotel with central location

Review: Â The hotel is very clean, appears modern and I found the staff both helpful and efficient.  Being next to Central Station means these premises are in a really handy central location within easy walking distance of shops, bars and food.  Of course, you can almost fall from the station into the Hotel if you arrive by train.  The breakfast here is faultless - everyting you could imagine and quality too.

Â The staff were amazing. From the moment we checked in to the moment we left. They were extremely helpful. I booked The Apartment for my fiances birthday. I was blown away by everything in here. So much space, complimentary drinks, really comfortable bed, great view and just an amazing experience.
We didn't have a single problem. We will be going back here and booking the apartment again. It was expensive but trust me.... the whole experience made it worth it including the dinner and breakfast too. What an amazing time we had here. Highly recommended staying here!!

Review: Â Helpful, friendly reception staff.  Delicious breakfast with excellent choice of hot and cold food.  Fresh toast, tea and coffee served to the table.  Pleasant bar area.  Had one evening meal at the hotel - tasty.  Room comfortable and shower excellent.  We had a standard room and would have liked more hanging space for our clothes and more drawers.  We enjoyed the location of the hotel with Central Station close by.  Staff very friendly and helpful throughout the hotel.  We had a lovely 5 day stay and would be most happy to return at some time.
Title: Lovely rejuvenating autumn break in an exceptionally friendly hotel.

Review: Â Booked the business class suite for myself & my partner for the 1 night. Situated perfectly as we attended a show at the SSE Hydro. Staff were First Class, second to none. Extremely polite and friendly. Could not do enough for us and went out of their way to go above and beyond and exceed our expectations. Spent a bit of money of the Suite and ordered a room package for my partner as it was her birthday surprise, again exceeded expectations and we were delighted by the time, effort and thought put into it. We received 2 free drinks tokens with our package, again this was a delight to our ears. Asked staff to book us a taxi for our outing and within seconds, one was waiting at the front door. Would highly recommend and will certainly be back very soon in the future as we have stayed here many times before and I will return to start racking up the points on my Loyalty Card that I was issued. Overall, really impressed with the High Class Standards.
Title: Ideally located, first class service and great experience in a lively & friendly environment.

Review:
Â The location of the Radisson Blu hotel in Glasgow is one of the major reasons why I choose to stay at the hotel as it is  located next to Glasgow Central Railway Station and the main shopping centre for Central Glasgow.  
St. Enoch Metro is  a short walking distance away.  
Merchant city and West End of Glasgow is also close to the Radisson Blu hotel. 
Glasgow International is a 15 minute taxi journey from the hotel.
The hotel itself was well maintained and cleanliness was generally good.
There is a restaurant and bar at the hotel.
The restaurant has 2 bars one within the restaurant area of the hotel and another bar located on the corner of the hotel.
The breakfast service provided by the hotel offers a good choice of food to cater for all tastes.
I was highly impressed by how well the morning restaurant manager managed the operation of the busy restaurant and how attentive her team were in serving all the customers quickly and efficiently with a smile on their faces and the utmost courtesy given to all customers.
I want to say well done and thank you to Alexandra the morning restaurant manager and her  team on their dedication and professionalism.
Title: Pleasant

Review: Â Having stayed previously I know how faultless this hotel can be however, there were a few hiccups on this occasion. I find the ice machine on each floor a great asset and highlight to this hotel however, none on floor 2 and 3 had been filled. However, when we phoned down to reception they asked if we were aware of the ice machines, when we explained they brought us up a bucket of ice to our room in under 5 minutes. Another hiccup was the water wasnâ€™t working properly when we arrived (no cold water and was green in colour) however when we phoned reception they didnâ€™t specify why but said theyâ€™d sort it and quickly rectified the situation, even phoning to check in that it was clear. My guess would be in light of current situations in the world right now itâ€™s hard to keep on top of everything but the staff make up for it with efficiency.
Title: Relaxing, quiet, comfortable and still my favourite hotel!

Review: Â The room service breakfast menu could be both displayed and explained more explicitly. There was no indication for the guest to tick/number the boxes which meant that the order wasnâ€™t very clear. In my experience, a numbering layout works best. It may also be beneficial to adapt the layout so that if more than one guest is ordering room service breakfast, it is clearer and easier to understand what each guest wants individually rather than one big section of small boxes.

Â We booked 2 rooms for the 4 of us, the 1st one we got checked into was lovely (room338) comfortable, cosy, carpetted and very luxurious looking

Review: Â Highly recommended. Staff knows how to serve! And they work hard. The breakfast team! One team. I did c everyone helping out. Even the gerant (manager) was on the floor. No slow walking, no good steps to make sure that waiting time was short. And still friendly. Top performance. Bar was also excellent. And room... well they made sure that all was ready for the night, even cushion spray with a calming sent. That you see in top hotels. And price was good. Location as well. Fast bus to airport around corner. And modern. Subway easy! University grounds are a must. So of all the hotels I stayed in (more than 500) this is in top 20.
Title: Exceptional

Review: Â Not really the hotel's fault, but the area around is difficult to navigate in a car for someone not from the area.  I ended up driving around for about an hour in rush hour traffic trying to find the hotel and then figure out where the parking was.  I eventually found a spot on the street and walked several blocks to the hotel, which I had passed (but not the parking entrance).  The signage from the road is hard to see and combined with the poor support from my satnav is the reason why I struggled I think.  But the people at the hotel, once I did get there, were really helpful and drew me a map so I could move my car.  Once I had this in hand, it was no problem at all.
Title: Lovely hotel for a nice weekend break that is a bit special

Review:
Â Well, our stay was somewhat marred by a couple of problems.  First up we returned to our room (606, on the top floor) at around 9:30pm to be greeted by the most terrible noise resonating through the roof from what would appear to be the buildings cooling units above - seemingly with some rough bearings!  Being a Brit, I'm not a complainer, however this was awful and neither of us could sleep.  Reception handled the issue without question and moved us to another room, somewhat smaller and next to a disco being held for a function in the building.  Wow that was noisey, but it stopped at 11pm meaning finally, we could sleep.
My issue is that the hotel clearly knew there was an issue with the rooms on the top floor and it didnt come as a surprise to them when I asked to be moved.  I personally feel this its a bit of a naughty tactic to sell the room, knowing there is a problem and hope nobody complains - especially in this classification of hotel.
Disapointing to have our stay and comfort spolied by issues which the premises were capable of avoiding.  In defence however, my Â£15 parking charge was waived as an apology.
Title: Lovely, but could do better.

Â Drunks in the bar that were not residents who broke a glass and were swearing
No power from sockets in the morning we were checking out when given another room key to dry my hair, the housekeeper came into the room and  told me I shouldnâ€™t be in a clean room.
Concierge donâ€™t assist a lady with multiple bags
Concierge donâ€™t manage the parking in front of the building allowing a selfish individual to park across two spaces, my husband had to drive back around the block he then had to park on the road with traffic backing up behind it which was stressful.
We both agreed the hotel is lovely but the staff let it down.

Review:
Â They have just opened a new restaurant within the hotel. The ideas seem good but I wasn`t overly impressed. The portions were small for the price  - probably because they are trying to create an upscale feel. That would be fine if everything was perfect but it wasn`t. Both of our main dishes were slightly over-cooked and the monkfish portion was tiny. 
It also was not a very relaxing atmosphere. The staff were very busy but certain places where tables were placed had members of staff rushing past them constantly.
Title: Always a pleasant stay but the restaurant is going to have to keep an eye on the quality control

Review: Â Upon arrival we were disappointed with the layout of the room  - a post in the middle of the room made it difficult to see the TV and to easily move around the room - and the shower door leaked which left the bathroom floor wet through to brush your teeth etc - but settled in and accepted fine.  We went out into Glasgow and on return the whole of our landing smelt very badly of smoking.  We went into our room and it was worse - it was coming through the air conditioning.  When we advised reception they told us that we were on the floor with smoking rooms!!!  We booked a no smoking room and asked to be moved but they refused as they said all other rooms were full. This wasn't true as we looked at the availability online.  We should have been advised that we were on a smoking corridor and that our room would smell badly.  Very disingenuous of the hotel and very poor customer service when asked to be moved.  Completely spoiled our weekend away with no acknowledgement or apology from any staff.  When we checked out, no one asked if our staff had been ok so we weren't even given the opportunity to give feedback.
Title: Disappointing unneccesarily.  If we had been given a non-smoking room it would have been very good.

Review:
Â The breakfast service hasn't improved since my last stay, it was slow and staff forgot things. The wait staff seem to be run off their feet while there are several, seemingly senior staff floating around but too few wait staff. 
The bathroom could do with a bit of TLC, loose fittings, poor shower (powerful but dangerously varying water temperatures). 
The TV was freeview only which is fine, but half of the channels didn't work and there was not space to allow you to plug in cables as the TV was bolted to the walls.
Title: Comfortable but could use some work.

Review:
Â It is highly disingenuous to advertise a 3 course meal for Â£24.99 and then charge for vegetables; the food is nouvelle cuisine, which means it looks pretty but is hardly satisfying. I had to pay Â£3.50 for 3 slices of carrot, beet and parsnip and a further Â£3.50 for a small basket of chips. I could have hung the starter on the wall and framed it. The dessert was good.
My room was large and well appointed, but it was right next door to some kind of fan system ( air conditioning for the whole hotel) which was noisy and made sleeping difficult to begin with. I mentioned it at checkout and the receptionist said he would mention it to the duty manager. No change there then.
Title: Good

Review: Â When we arrived we were informed that there was no service in the dining room and only the bar would be open. Breakfast would be left outside the rooms at 0830. It was completely underwhelming, no milk, no cereals only a cereal bar and pastries but not fresh ones. On the last day we didn't find any breakfast outside the room so rang reception only to be told that the kitchens had opened but no-one had informed us.
Title: Ultimately disappointing

Review:
Â 1. Booked a junior suite got basic room. 
2. They gave me 20% discount ( that basically took to price of the standard of room ). 
3. Gave us a couple of drink vouchers for room service but when called room service I was told only for bar ( bar closed ). We got drinks but attitude of young man on reception was appalling. 
4. Eventually got our drinks with out bottle opener. 
So it was a very special night but ruined. 
Manager was very apologetic as he seen I was very unhappy. So gave us a voucher for free parking.  
Wonâ€™t use again staff in Hilton and standards much better so will use this hotel future.
Title: Very Poor

Review: Â Our room had no hot water at all. I tried to phone reception from the room phone but the phone rang a dial tone but nothing else happened. I tried to call reception from my mobile phone and I still had no answer. So we had to have a freezing cold shower in the morning. When we checked out in the morning we weren't asked how our stay was and if everything was okay. Also, we decided to go to the hotel bar for a drink at night however we had to find someone to take our drinks order for us as we had waited almost 15/20mins for someone to come take our order. Myself and my boyfriend found this very disappointing as we didn't expect this from a hotel chain like this since we paid a lot of money to stay which was for my boyfriends birthday and it kind of upset us both because it ruined our stay.
Title: nice hotel but poor facilities

Review:
Â The room they gave us, 323, had dirty curtains and the shower didn't work. We reported it in the morning and were promised it will get fixed. it wasn't fixed when we got back from our day out and when we rang reception to ask about it they were quite abrupt and rude 
A very nice engineer turned up and said it needed a new thermostatic valve and it could take upwards of 30 minutes to get fixed. Reception said we will be moved to a different room. I rang them to ask when was the move happening and to which room are we being moved. Initially they denied having  any knowledge of a move and when I insisted that they already said we could move as we needed to get ready for a reservation at a restaurant and couldn't wait for the shower to get fixed they yielded and sent the head concierge up who was apologetic and very helpful and professional.they moved us to room 508 which was a bit nicer but had no carpets, we only assume it was a smoking room despite us asking for the room to be non smoking. All in all this visit has been disappointing and not relaxed as we had hoped it to be.
Oh, and on check in I informed Cindy at reception that I hold a gold status with them. She did not offer me any upgrades so I asked for one and she immediately said that they already upgraded the room with a bigger bed... Now I am not sure how was that a gold member upgrade when they didn't know I was a gold member until then?.
Title: Could have been better

Review: Â Having stayed here a few times, the decline in overall quality has been noticeable over the past few years. The level of cleanliness, particularly in the bathrooms, needs to be improved greatly, and the quality of some of the furnishings is poor. The changes to the room service menu and reduction of items available is disappointing, as well as the choice to no longer pre-stock the mini bar.
Title: Great location for train, but standards beginning to drop

Review:
Â the toilet did not flush (jammed valve) when we first went into the room. It was repaired promptly but failed again 24 hours later and required us to be moved to another room. we were at the hotel for 2 nights and the move required us to pack and then unpacked. (our visit in December required the maintenance personnel to repair the air conditioning unit)
the bar staff need further training
the hotel appearance  is tired and needs a refurbish. there is new competition nearby
Title: overall our thoughts on our visit was disappointing and will now reconsider where we stay

Review:
Â Check in by David was hopeless.  Two rooms and meant to be set up each room with facility of adding drinks to the room. Unfortunately,  he only set up one tab, not two. This caused issues later on when trying to buy drinks by charging it to the room.
Toilets were an issue.  Smashed glass and slippy floor due to overflowing urinal. Reported to cloakroom staff.
Title: Let down by  reception staff and toilets.

Review: Â The TV service could be better - it was not very intuitive to rent a movie as advertised and was very laggy navigating between screens (you need to wait a few noticeable seconds before the TV responds to the button press).

Review: Â The TV service could be better - it was not very intuitive to rent a movie as advertised and was very laggy navigating between screens (you need to wait a few noticeable seconds before the TV responds to the button press).

Review: Â We dropped off our luggage in the room and went shopping,on return I tried to watch the TV but it would not work,"maintenance in progress" would appear on the screen.After about an hour tried to call reception about it but the handset was not connected to the phone!.The desk light would not work and my bedside light had a mind of its own,if you touched the switch or cable it would go off and on.There is black mould in the bathroom,totally unacceptable in this standard of hotel and the walls in the room are covered in dust.Room requires a total deep clean,we reported most of this to reception and when we returned later the TV ,phone and desk light were working but not the bedside light was still the same.It appears the hotel standards are slipping
Title: Disapointing

Whole stay did not feel comfortable in your hotel made to feel like an outcast by staff and guests looking down at us as we dressed different, never judge a book by its cover we, re paying like every one else. I WILL NEVER BE BACK HERE AND WOULDN'T RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE was looking forward to a little break be glad to get home.

Title: Pleasant

Review:
Â First of all this criticism is to Booking com because as a customer booking a hotel room,  I have to trust the information provided to me on the Booking.com App.
Unfortunately Booking.com really misled me and has most probably misled many other customers because the photographs Booking.com are showing for a Standard room at the Radisson Blu Hotel in Glasgow do not in any way actually resemble the actual Standard rooms at the Radisson Blu Hotel in Glasgow.
I based my choice of selecting a Standard Room on the advertised photographs shown on the Booking.com App.The photographs shown of a Standard room at the Radisson Blu hotel on the Booking.com App are of a Premium room and not a Standard Room.
This is utterly unacceptable and misleading customers.
When I  checked into the hotel and went to my room, I was shocked and very upset to find my room was bright red and had wooden flooring.
This was not want I expected and I immediately went back to the Hotel Reception desk and informed the  reception team member that I  can not stay in the room.
Thankfully the reception team offered me another room  to stay in at no extra cost which resembled the type of room being advertised on the Booking.com App for a Standard room at the Radisson Blu hotel in Glasgow.
Another issue that I found strange was that the hotel takes a Â£50 per night security deposit if you want to use the hotel bar after 12 midnight.
So the hotel will immediately take deposit on your credit card for you as a customer to be able to purchase drinks at the bar after 12 midnight.
The hotel bar does not take any cash as payment and will only take payment on your credit card.
I stayed 3 nights and I had to pay a deposit of Â£150.00.
The deposit is refunded back to your credit cards a few days after you check out.
What my point is that the hotel even after paying the Â£50 per night deposit still takes payments which are charged to your room account.
I do not understand the real purpose of this Â£50 deposit  rule.
Title: Pleasant

Review:
Â Overpriced and not a good experience at all!.  By no means a five star hotel anymore!  Had to ask for two adjoining rooms despite requesting this and having two kids with us!! The Gym and pool not available and were not advised of this prior to arrival.  This was partly the reason for booking this hotel.  We Were offered to be taken to local Marriot hotel to use their facilities which in our opinion Totally defeated the purpose of booking this hotel!    Our TV did not work in the room - we advised desk and it was sorted but then failed to work on our return later for the remainder of our stay! 
As an aside - A particular male staff member/ bouncer was very rude and intimidating on us returning back to the hotel after 10pm with our children.  I am not one to complain but given the cost of our stay I cannot ignore this.  Will not be back at this hotel and definitely not recommend it!!
Title: Disappointing

Review: Â On arrival, as soon as the receptionist registered that room had been paid for it was as if his job was done and had no interest in providing a service. This was my first time staying with the hotel and he didnâ€™t explain where amenities were, how to get to my room or checkout time. Room is in need of TLC and a good cleaning. Chipped areas on woodwork, no mini bar, chewing gum stuck under furniture, dusty shelves and sinks hadnâ€™t been cleaned as there was pencil sharpening in it. Really disappointing for the price I paid considering I didnâ€™t even opt for breakfast.
Title: Not value for money & cleanliness + staff could improve.

Review: Â The bathroom was dingy and the bed hard and uncomfortable. We weren't impressed with the room whatsoever. The lobby was cold and constantly hit by bursts of gross cigarette smoke as people attending special events at the hotel congregated right in front of the lobby doors, were constantly in and out, and sometimes even prop the doors open. We had several bizarre interactions with a staff person in the lobby, whose role we are unclear on, who approached us anytime we were on our way in or out and wouldn't leave us alone (and yet was ineffective at following through on any of our requests).
Title: Fine for convenience, but not worth the weekend price. You can do much better.

Review: Â Decor was tired and shabby. Piped music everywhere was awful and loud. Bar tables weren't cleaned. Traffic noise on 2nd floor was too loud. The bed was ridiculously soft. Title: Overpriced disappointing experience

Breakfast was bang average - scrambled eggs pale and tasteless, sausages undercooked, bacon overcooked. Expected better. There was no mention of the remodelling going on in the foyer when booking the stay and the angle grinder wasn't quiet. Considering the price it was on the whole disappointing.

Review:
Â MY STAY AT THE RADISSON BLU GLASGOW from 11 October to 14th October 2018
I stayed at the Radisson Blu Hotel in Glasgow from the evening of Thursday 11th October until the morning of Sunday 14th October 2018.
As this was my third visit I had booked the Junior Suite from some months in advance, having previously stayed in their standard, and then their business class occasions.  I was quoted and took what I considered a good price of Â£500 plus for the 3 nights.
Apart from the suite being very cold at night due to it having only wooden floors (not carpet as I had expected) everything went well until the morning of Saturday 13th October when one of the staff at Reception behaved incorrectly and was rude to me and my guests.  The member of Staff had a name tag that read Praveen.
As on previous occasions I came to Glasgow to visit my friends â€“ a mother and her daughter.  They visited me on Friday and we sat in the seating area of my suite (which is why I booked the suite in the first place) and enjoyed lunch together in the Collage Bar.
On Saturday morning I awaited their arrival in the lobby as the Collage bar was closed and as part of the lobby was under construction I waited for them in the corner. Mr. Praveen came and asked me whether he could help, and I said I was awaiting friends.  I was friendly to him and wished him â€œbless youâ€ in Hindi (I am from Malaysia) to which he was quick to say that he wasnâ€™t Indian but that one of his parents was Frenchâ€¦
When my friends arrived at 9.30 am  , I went to greet them, and he promptly came up and asked us where we were going so I replied to my suite whereupon he officiously told us that only 2 people were allowed in the suite due to fire regulations.  I pointed out to him that my friends were NOT STAYING and were just visiting but he insisted at which point I told him that I had a suite with a separate seating area and that was why I booked a suite and he said he would check. My guests were most offended.
He never came
Title: Fair

Title: Did not enjoy my stay at all .

Review: Â Pool access is restricted at weekend ,infact itâ€™s only open till 2pm Saturday but check in is 3pm, Sundayâ€™s the pool is closed? We picked hotel specifically because it had a pool.  Check in was effecient but no briefing of breakfast times, where it was served, no info advising of Bar or serving times, no one told us the pool wasnâ€™t available at weekends. At breakfast no one approached us to take our order from the breakfast menu we had no choice but to choose from the continental menu. Room was nice but never a superior room in my opinion .  Water in bathroom sink wouldnâ€™t drain away because the plug was broken and wouldnâ€™t pop up.
Title: Wonâ€™t return to this hotel.

Â Restaurant is way below standard - dinner, breakfast and service.
There was building alterations taking place in the lobby and a huge function on our first evening which generated high noise both while having dinner and then could be heard in fourth floor room till after midnight. Would not stay at this hotel again, it simply was inhospitable.

Review: Â Our experience of breakfast on our first morning was extremely disappointing. We had been advised that breakfast was available between 7.30 to 10.30am. However having arrived at around 9.45am most of the hot buffet dishes were almost empty also the Loren sausage and breakfast was so over cooked or over heated it was so dried up and therefore inedible. To add to this we saw all the hot dishes being switched off at 10.15am and then advised by staff that the buffet would be unavailable at 10.30! We noticed guests arriving at 10.20 and 10.25 which was unacceptable to guests as staff were starting to remove the cold items from the buffet. We are Club Carlson members and regular users of the Raddidon at London Stansted but sadly found this experience very poor. The same cut off time occurred during the next two morning of our stay.
Title: The service from reception front of house staff and porters was exemplary, excellent a credit to you

Review:
Â Despite numerous phone calls and numerous requests it appears that the staff are either incapable or unable to send a simple email. I requested that my bill was emailed to me and yet almost a week later and all the inconvenience of calling them they have still not sent one 
Given that the "printer was out of ink" at check out (and they were therefore unable to present me with an invoice) I can only assume that once they have taken payment they have no reason to or intention to provide any service after that
Title: Frustrating.....

Review: Â The meal. I complained last time and was persuaded to return (I did not take up the offer of a free meal). I was told there is a new cook ('chef' is an honorific that has to be deserved) since I last came. Sadly it was worse. the steaks (one medium and one well done) were both burnt to a crisp and pretty clearly under weight. Servings tiny - but hardly 'fine dining'. The sauce made my colleague ill. We did not say anything - what is the point as it clearly did not make any difference before.
Title: Room fine but do not eat here
